alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 20 at 5:26PM MST until July 20 at 8:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Yavapai County including Prescott Valley in west central Arizona... * Until 830 PM MST. * At 525 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Prescott Valley mainly south of Highway 89A. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Prescott Valley and Prescott Valley Event Center. This includes the following highways... State Route 69 between mile markers 280 and 288. State Route 89A between mile markers 323 and 324. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Agua Fria River, Coyote Wash, Lynx Creek and Winters Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
